rComments: Avoid ENVS25 with Haddad. It was all about the essays when I took it. 36 hours to write them and the prompts made no sense. Everyone was on WebCT late into the night, interpreting them. The online discussions with classmates were an interesting and valuable experience, but not worth it. I've never taken such a difficult course before or since.

well, it could be a pretty interesting class, but it was boring as hell. hes a really smart guy, knows what hes talking about, but he talks out of the book, which he wrote, and is what he uses for lectures. he changes the way he grades year to year, this last year was only 2 tests, but there have been essays in the past. fair class, decent prof.

This class was horrible. Professor Haddad made no effort to make the material engaging, and the tests were ridiculous. I failed both, and STILL got a solid C in the class. Didn't learn anything that made it worth while, nearly impossible to make it through lectures without sleeping, and if you aren't out, you're neighbor is.
He's nice, but the lectures are dull. There are only two tests: a midterm and final. Take it only if you need to.

Brent is a nice guy and he presents the material well. The actually lecture is boring but I think it is the subject matter more than the professor. Grades were based on 40% midterm 60% final but he offers extra credit. If you don't have to take this class don't but it is bearable if you have to. Biao is adorable!! and Tim passes notes during class.

This class is horrible! The lectures are impossible to follow and Haddad makes no effort to keep students engaged. There are two exams: a midterm and a final; 40% and 60% of final grade respectively. These exams are difficult, you need to match the correct author with a one sentence summary. Midterm 25authors, Final50+Memorize 200pgs of lect book

I took this class because the topic sounded interesting, it was a GE I needed and I didnt think it would be too difficult. What I got was the most boring lectures known to man and wicked tests. You are only graded off the midterm and final. The tests have very very little to do with what he lectures on. There is no textbook, just a reader. HARD TES

extremely boring, very very dry material.  he switches up basing the class on just the midterm and final, and basing it on a few essays.  The class will be extremely easy if you get to write essays but very hard if its just tests.  The tests focused on random facts no one bothered to memorize because they did not matter.  class average was 56.

He's very boring, his midterm was a horrible reflection of the course material with a significant amount of quotes we never focused on and basing our grades on just midterm/final is stupid. He also apparently redid grades in Winter quarter last school year because there were too many Bs, which is just absurd. Sad I have to take this for my major.

Brent is a nice guy...but the class is boooooring.  I honestly wish that our grade was based on essays (we didn't write any)..this quarter he decided to have our grade be 40% midterm, 60% final...Not a fan.  Very dry subject matter.

He is really passionate about this subject and is involved on many levels to address the water crises. He's a really funny quirky guy and likes to share personal stories related to whatever he's lecturing on lol. He does classic lectures:no ppt slides or visuals so you miiight zone out during lectures. All tests and hw are based on lectures so go!

Water is his favorite topic--thus it's no surprise that he thought this class much better than envs 25. WONDERFUL CLASS, TAKE THIS! the entire class was there everyday, ready to go 20 mintues before class even started--it was sooo good. he is the jolliest man ever, and you could not possibly regret this course!  HE IS ADORABLE!

Very boring class, but very very easy. No tests, only a few essays that you only have 2 days to do. If that's fine with you and you need to take this class, take it. VERY boring, but once again VERY easy.
Haddad's class is pretty easy...lecture may be boring sometimes because he of the way he teaches but i found the subject to be overall interesting so i enjoyed the class.
EASY CLASS.. just 4 essays. no finals. attendance quizzes are just writing name down, write date down, and the topic he is talking about for the day. EASY.

horrible class. do not take it as a GE. he makes you buy his lecture book and he basically reads off of that book during lecture (the book has 400 pages and the font is like size 30.. kinda sad how he teaches env studies and wastes paper like that) gives you 2 - 3 days to write 5 - 7 page essays on a dry prompt. he also has a set # of A's and B's
horrible class. do not take it as a GE. Though there were no tests he gave us 2 - 3 days to write 5 - 7 page essays on boring/dry topics. and he has a set number of A's and B's. AVOID IF POSSIBLE!!

Haddad is a very sweet man; he has a passion for his subject but he doesn't elaborate off the lecture notes. Honestly, not a very interesting class and the essays were stressful, seeing we only had 3 days to write them.

Very boring class. Had to force myself to go everyday, just in case we had an in class quiz. Though his passion for the subject is obvious, it doesn't translate well when he tries to teach it. The essay prompts were dry and boring, assigned about 2-3 days before it was due. There are no exams, but I'd rather take the exams then the 5-7pg papers.
Terrible class. Most boring thing I have ever experienced and he assigns 5-7 page essays and gives you about two days to do it. Reads straight from book, horrible class.

Brent was boring and read directly off the lecture notes. It wasn't very much fun sitting through the lectures especially since they were huge, but overall I learned a lot from the class and he is really a great person.

Great teacher, very knowledgeable about all aspects regarding water,  definitely your go to guy, passionate about the subject, most of the time the subject matter was interesting and engaging, would highly recommend taking this class.

Took this class last year. Interesting but didnt seem that great, but you'd be surprised how much info sticks with you from this class. He is VERY passionate about his subj, esp water policy. His material is important for envs majors. The readings are awesome and its an easy class, except u get no study guide, so that makes it hard. U wnt regret it

This class has a lot of potential to be great.  I was very interested in the subject material, but he makes it very boring b/c he has a monotonous voice and reads straight from the reader. the reason class is mandatory is b/c he has quizzes to make sure ppl go to class.  dont take this class if you dont have to, great subject, bad teacher.

Prof. Haddad is very knowledgeable but ENVS25 is nothing amazing. It is a broad class based in theory of environmentalism.  The class can be kind of boring, but you will leave with a more solid understanding of some aspects underlying environmentalism.  the book is great book that is actually worth reading. The class is not as cool as it name

It's not too hard of a class if you attend lecture. Study the reader, which is comprised of the lecture slides. The quizes are the only real reason attendance is necessary, but otherwise you could just study the lectures and do well on the tests.
Good guy, BAD teacher!!! Do not take this class if you dont have to!

so prof. haddad is kinda a bore, but the class isn't too hard. the tests are straight forward, and we didn't have to write a single paper that was over 500 words. his lectures aren't totally pointless, but if you miss a few you should be okay!
His voice is very monotonous and he makes the subject material boring

PE&E: Dont be fooled by the intriguing title because policy is seldom discussed and the class is based in vague theory. The readings are mostly boring and poorly written, and the lectures consist of putting up overhead slides that we already have. His lectures are in no way illuminating and are impossible to pay attention to. Horrible Organization.

Prof. Haddad is an awesome guy. He is so approachable and an all around wonderful teacher. His lower division classes are a bore I hear, but any upper division class he offers I recommend you take it. He is so excited about water and policy it's scary. He talks a lot, so if you aren't ready for a teacher to lecture old school style 100% of the time
Could have done better with the course subject. Assignments not too engaging, exams more difficult than they had to be.

very practical and interesting information;don't need to be an envs major to enjoy this class. prof very helpful and extremely hospitable. The book of lecture notes that's provided helps us follow him in class instead of having to try to write down everythig he has on the screen AND listen to what he's saying. tests are NOT hard if you STUDY

DO NOT take this class if you aren't an envs. major. I am, but I was bored out of my mind. I really cared about the material too. Haddad is nice enough, but the class is structured badly. You don't need to take notes because he sells them in a class reader. Then he reads them to you (word for word). and that's the class. attendence is mandatory.

I'm not particularly fond of his teaching style, but Haddad definitely does make an effort to help his students out grade-wise. 40 percent of our grade was attendance! If it wasn't for little freebees here and there, I definitely wouldn't have survived. The tests are insane (not to scare you or anything). Hehe good luck!

pretty boring, he basically just reads what you have in your reader, it would be easy not to go to lectures and if you study on your own but attendance is a big part so you pretty much have to go. seems like a nice enough guy but the information is super general and its feels like your not really studying because its so broad.

Okay, the previous ratings are much too harsh!  Haddad's class IS hard, but if you take notes in class and do the reading, you will do fine.  And if you don't understand the material, go to his office hours!  He is super nice and will be happy to help!

this class is awful. all haddad does is read you overheads that you have in your book. there is no point in going to class. UNFORTUNATELY attendance is a huge part of your grade. don't take this class. you will regret it. i am so interested in the material but he manages to make it suck.

Sitting in a room for two hours looking at overheads wears me out after the first week.  It made going to class a real bore.  I lost interest half way and looked forward to sections where we didn't just look at overheads all day.  His tests were too hard, and his essays were very unclear and vague.  However, he was looking for a specific answer to his question.  NOT A GOOD CLASS TO JUMP INTO IF NOT AN ENVS MAJOR!
No Comments
Lectures are boring and too broad.  Don't take for a GE.  Study your notes often for the tests. Nice guy.  Julie is a great TA.

so Brent is a nice guy and some of the material is interesting, but overall, if you're taking this for GE, it's probably not the class for you. you don't have to do too much for this class though, but go to class, take notes (suggest bringing computer), do all the assignments and study.

The material for this class was mostly boring and useless, though it needn't have been.  He is a nice guy, but his teaching style is weak. The material isn't hard, but he is the kind of teacher that tries to put the most obscure info on the test so it can be really challenging and frusterating.

Basically copy notes from the overhead the whole class.  He will stop and take questions though, and does a good job of answering them when they come up.  Also very friendly and personable.  Tests can be really hard though.  I recommend trying to find an old one to get an idea of his testing style.

he sucks. lectures are boring and straight from overhead. he tries to elaborate but there is no need. you have to write for the whole class to be able to copy all the notes. dont take his class he tries to make it way more difficult than it needs to be.

Lots of notes and in the begining its not very interesting at all.  Recomend taking it pass/no pass if your not an ENVS major, theres a lot of material he covers and sometimes the test content is random.  Some of the topics are intersting.

Teaches challenging classes, but his expectations are more realistic than they seem. Take advantage of the "meet the professor" assignment; he is personable and goofy, in an endearing way. In short, he won't do the work for you, but if you're motivated he'll go out of his way to help you.

Cool guy. Lecture was fine, because you were to busy writtin to really think about anything else. Tests really really hard. DO NOT TAKE AS GE. I did and it was super hard and lots of time commitment for a good grade, which i dont even think I got

he made the class very boring. lots of overhead notetaking. his talking did not add anything to the overhead notes, he might as well not said anything and just let us copy. i think  i would have stayed awake more. also his tests were very unrealistic. we had to remember definitions word for word!
Kinda boring, but once you meet him, he's quite endearing and it makes the lectures better

I had high expectations for the class. The material is really interesting, but professor Haddad is not. He is unclear about the tests. You write constantly, take 5-7 pages of overhead notes in an hour. I agree with the first comment, don't take for a Gen Ed!

He often goes way too fast during lecture. He doesn't give out a study guide. He has random assignments. He's a nice person, but makes the course harder than it should be. Don't take this class just for a GE!
No Comments

Very sweet and friendly, but also very tough. Will not give credit for late assignments. Lots of experience with negotiating policy decisions. Focus on fresh water policy and associated environmental issues. Expects students to attend all lectures and gives credit for attendance. Very patient.
Haddad was sweet, but quite boring. the class was unengaging, but real easy.
